newsitem.title: USA: USDA sees quick solution to China poultry problem.
newsitem.headline: USDA sees quick solution to China poultry problem.

text.p: U.S. Department of Agriculture Dairy, Livestock and Poultry Division Director John Reddington said Thursday he expected a quick resolution to a Chinese stoppage of poultry imports from 10 U.S. states.
"When we sit down with the Chinese government in cases like this the problem usually disappears," Reddington told Reuters.
He said there were no cases of avian influenza in the United States at present, and he expected Chinese officials to accept the situation.
Reddington said it was not clear if the stoppage affected shipments to one or more Chinese provinces or to the whole country.
He said he did not have the full list of the 10 affected U.S. states but said they included Arkansas, Maryland, Minnesota, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina and Utah.
No other major poultry producing states were affected, he said.
